author: Ignacio Poggio
title: Boeing, en huelga: qu√© reclaman los trabajadores y c√≥mo afecta a los pasajeros
text: Tras semanas de intensas negociaciones, los trabajadores de Boeing han decidido iniciar una huelga luego de rechazar un acuerdo propuesto entre los sindicatos y la empresa aeron√°utica estadounidense. El acuerdo contemplaba un aumento salarial del 25 % a lo largo de cuatro a√±os, un incremento que los empleados consideran insuficiente ante la creciente inflaci√≥n y una d√©cada de estancamiento salarial. El 95 % de los miembros del sindicato International Association of Machinist (IAM) vot√≥ en contra de esta propuesta, argumentando que no refleja el verdadero costo de vida y las necesidades actuales de los trabajadores. Boeing teme p√©rdidas millonarias: el antecedente que preocupa a la empresa La huelga de los trabajadores de Boeing llega en un momento cr√≠tico para la empresa, ya que detendr√° la producci√≥n de aviones en un contexto en el que la compa√±√≠a enfrenta una crisis por el incidente del Boeing 737 MAX 9 de Alaska Airlines. Esto acentuar√° la escasez de aeronaves en el sector, afectando tanto a las aerol√≠neas como a los pasajeros. A pesar de los intentos del nuevo director ejecutivo, Kelly Ortberg, de disuadir a los trabajadores de la huelga con visitas a las f√°bricas, los 33.000 empleados representados por el sindicato Distrito 751 de la IAM han decidido continuar con la medida de fuerza. Este paro laboral ser√≠a el primero en 16 a√±os, rememorando la huelga de 2008 que dur√≥ m√°s de 50 d√≠as y le cost√≥ a Boeing aproximadamente 100 millones de d√≥lares diarios, seg√∫n informes de medios como The Wall Street Journal y Financial Times. Boeing hab√≠a anunciado un acuerdo que no fue Ante la presi√≥n de la huelga inminente, Boeing hab√≠a anunciado el pasado fin de semana un acuerdo provisional con el sindicato que representa a m√°s de 33.000 empleados. Aunque el aumento salarial del 25 % no alcanza el 40 % solicitado por el sindicato, entraron en la negociaci√≥n otros beneficios clave para mejorar las condiciones laborales. La oferta, finalmente rechazada, inclu√≠a avances significativos en aspectos como la jubilaci√≥n y el permiso parental, buscando un equilibrio entre las demandas de los trabajadores y la viabilidad econ√≥mica de la empresa. Los puntos principales de la oferta que rechazaron los trabajadores - Aumento salarial del 25 % en cuatro a√±os. - Incrementos adicionales por antig√ºedad, elevando el salario medio en un 33 %. - Mejores prestaciones de jubilaci√≥n con mayores contribuciones de la empresa. - Hasta 12 semanas de permiso parental retribuido. - Reducci√≥n en los costos de atenci√≥n m√©dica para los empleados. En este mismo sentido y con la intenci√≥n de ponderar el acuerdo, la directora general de Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Stephanie Pope, se√±al√≥ a su vez en un mensaje a los empleados que la oferta "proporciona el mayor aumento salarial general hasta la fecha, una menor participaci√≥n en los costos m√©dicos para que la atenci√≥n m√©dica sea m√°s asequible, mayores contribuciones de la empresa para la jubilaci√≥n y mejoras para un mejor equilibrio entre el trabajo y la vida personal". Evidentemente, los trabajadores no coinciden con ella y las negociaciones continuar√°n.

O Athletic Bilbao venceu de forma enf√°tica o Atl√©tico Madrid (3-0) na 2.¬™ m√£o das meias-finais da Ta√ßa do Rei. No primeiro encontro, j√° vencera em Madrid por 1-0 e confirmou assim a sua superioridade perante os colchoneros .

Independentemente do vencedor dessa partida, as duas equipas tamb√©m j√° carimbaram presen√ßa na disputa pela Superta√ßa de Espanha.

author: Maya Boddie
title: 'Everybody‚Äôs jaw just dropped': Analyst predicts what will likely 'impact' Carroll trial jurors
text:
'Everybody‚Äôs jaw just dropped': Analyst predicts what will likely 'impact' Carroll trial jurors
Ahead of closing arguments for writer E. Jean Carroll's defamation trial against Donald Trump set to begin Friday, January 26, legal analyst Lisa Rubin explained what happened inside of the courtroom Thursday as the former president unexpectedly testified.
"This is a day that I thought would really never come," Rubin told MSNBC host Alicia Menendez. "I have told you, and I have told MSNBC viewers for weeks that I never thought Donald Trump would stake the stand. And so for me, the moment traumatic moment was at 2:15 today when [Trump attorney] Alina Habba said 'the defense calls President Donald Trump,' and everybody's jaw just dropped. Because, collectively, I think there's a feeling that it was not only a mistake, but something we really didn't count on happening. When you talked about the three questions that Alina Habba was permitted to ask, we're going to have to see the transcript because the questions weren't stricken. In fact, only portions of the answers were struck in each case. And so we're going to have to see exactly what the Judge Kaplan allowed and didn't allow. My own recollection is Donald Trump is allowed to answer the second two questions in 'yes' or 'no' ways. Did you deny it because you wanted to defend yourself? 'Yes, I did.'
The analyst noted, "And then he continued to say it's totally false, and that's when Judge Kaplan cut him off. Similarly, he was asked 'did you instruct anyone to hurt her?' He said, 'no,' from my notes, 'I just wanted to protect myself, my family and the presidency.' That sentence was stricken. But I'm not sure that the 'no' was. But irrespective of that, there were just three questions. I would be curious to see whether that has any impact on this jury or not, particularly when, as you noted earlier in the afternoon, we were treated to an array of clips from Donald Trump's prior depositions, not only in this case, but also in the New York attorney general's deposition in the civil fraud trial that I have been following. And where we expect a decision either next week or shortly thereafter on Judge Arthur Engoron's own promise."
POLL:
Should Trump be allowed to hold office again?
Rubin emphasized, "In that deposition, Donald Trump talked extensively about his net worth, his brand value, the amount of cash that he has on hand, what each individual property might be worth if he sold it. And overall, his conclusion, which lingered with the jury and everyone present, was his self-profession that he's worth billions upon billions of dollars. And that has to make an impact with these jurors, who are going to be asked not only to assess what amount of money is due to E. Jean Carroll to compensate her for the harm to her reputation and the pain and suffering that she has gone through, but also, what amount of punitive damages should be awarded to punish Donald Trump for his conduct, for his failure to stop defaming her after the initial verdict, and instead to continue doing so in a Truth Social post ‚Äî including as recently as this morning ‚Äî and in a 30-plus post storm last night."

at this link.
